message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.SY, cs.MM, cs.CR

The paper discusses the design and performance of a simultaneous transmission and reception (STR) system, which involves signal processing and communication networks. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.IT (Information Theory), which deals with the fundamental limits of data compression, communication, and cryptography. The paper also discusses the impact of STR on network performance, which suggests that it could belong to cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture). Additionally, the paper proposes a closed-loop echo cancellation technique, which could fall under cs.SY (Systems and Control). The paper also mentions the application of STR in cellular systems, which could be related to cs.MM (Multimedia) or cs.CR (Cryptography and Security).
